author: Flashpoint

classifier.description: Incoming Mapper for Flashpoint Compromised Credentials
classifier.name: Flashpoint Compromised Credentials - Incoming Mapper

incidentfield.description: The link of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Link to Alert

incidentfield.description: Type of source of the breach.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Breach Source Type

incidentfield.description: The title of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Title

incidentfield.description: Link to the alerted source.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source URL

incidentfield.description: The original site or platform where the resource was published.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Site Title

incidentfield.description: Data source of breach (i.e. Analyst Research, CredentialStealer, etc.).
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Breach Source

incidentfield.description: This is the domain object extracted off of the email address.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source Domain

incidentfield.description: Repository name.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source Repo

incidentfield.description: The probable hash algorithm information of the password.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Password Probable Hash Algorithms

incidentfield.description: The Flashpoint ID of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint ID

incidentfield.description: If exists, time object for when the credential was previously observed. Datetime object formatted as YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SSZ.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Last Observed Date

incidentfield.description: The handle of the user who created the message, authored the blog post, or posted a product for sale.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Site Actor Names

incidentfield.description: The ID of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Alert ID

incidentfield.description: The type of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source Basetypes

incidentfield.description: Code repository platform.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source

incidentfield.description: The information about password complexity of the credential.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Password Information

incidentfield.description: Affected domain of the IoC.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Affected Domain

incidentfield.description: The body of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Alert Text

incidentfield.description: Victim of the breach.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Victim

incidentfield.description: The value of the keyword.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Keyword Text

incidentfield.description: File name for the matched alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source File

incidentfield.description: Sort date of the alert.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Sort Date

incidentfield.description: The ID used by the original site for the resource.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Native ID

incidentfield.description: The email address for the compromised credential.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Compromised Email

incidentfield.description: Timestamp for when this document was indexed into the Flashpoint database.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Header Indexed At Date

incidentfield.description: The first observed date of the alert. Datetime object formatted as YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SSZ.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint First Observed Date

incidentfield.description: The password for the credential (in plain text, if possible).
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Compromised Password

incidentfield.description: Author of the repo.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Source Owner

incidentfield.description: This will be "true" if the credential has not been seen before, and it hasn't been marked "not fresh" by an analyst.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Is Fresh

incidentfield.description: The created date of the alert. Datetime object formatted as YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SSZ.
incidentfield.name: Flashpoint Created Date

commands.description: Looks up details of an IP indicator. The reputation of the IP address is considered malicious if there's at least one IOC event in the Flashpoint database that matches the IP indicator. Alternatively, the IP address is considered suspicious if it matches any one of the Torrent's Peer IP Address or Forum Visit's Peer IP Address.
commands.name: ip

commands.description: Lookup the "Domain" type indicator details. The reputation of Domain is considered Malicious if there's at least one IOC event in Flashpoint database matching the Domain indicator.
commands.name: domain

commands.description: Lookup the "Filename" type indicator details. The reputation of Filename is considered Malicious if there's at least one IOC event in Flashpoint database matching the Filename indicator.
commands.name: filename

commands.description: Lookup the "URL" type indicator details. The reputation of Url is considered Malicious if there's at least one IOC event in Flashpoint database matching the Url indicator.
commands.name: url

commands.description: Lookup the "File" type indicator details. The reputation of File-hash is considered Malicious if there's at least one IOC event in Flashpoint database matching the File-hash indicator.
commands.name: file

commands.description: Lookup the "Email" type indicator details. The reputation of Email is considered Malicious if there's at least one IOC event in Flashpoint database matching the Email indicator.
commands.name: email

commands.description: Search for the Intelligence Reports using a keyword
commands.name: flashpoint-search-intelligence-reports

commands.description: Get single report details using the report id. The report id can be known from output context path (Flashpoint.Report.ReportId) of report-search command or some other investigation.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-single-intelligence-report

commands.description: Get related reports for a particular report using the report-id. The report id can be known from output context path (Flashpoint.Report.ReportId) of report-search command or some other investigation.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-related-reports

commands.description: Retrieves the details of a single event using event UUID or FPID. To retrieve the event id, run the get-events command and see the value under the Flashpoint.Event.EventId context path. or indicator reputation command response or some other investigation.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-single-event

commands.description: Searches for events within the specified time-period, the report fpid, or attack IDs.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-events

commands.description: Lookup any type of indicator
commands.name: flashpoint-common-lookup

commands.description: Retrieves forum details using the forum ID. To retrieve the forum ID run the flashpoint-search-forum-posts command and see the value under the following context paths, Flashpoint.Forum.ForumId or Flashpoint.Forum.Post.Forum.id.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-forum-details

commands.description: Retrieves forum room details using the room ID. To retrieve the room ID run the flashpoint-search-forum-posts command and see the value under the Flashpoint.Forum.Post.Room.id context path.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-forum-room-details

commands.description: Retrieves user details using the user-id. To retrieve the user ID, run the flashpoint-search-forum-posts command and see the value under the Flashpoint.Forum.Post.User.id context path.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-forum-user-details

commands.description: Retrieves post details using the post-id. To retrieve the post ID, run the flashpoint-search-forum-posts command and see the value under the Flashpoint.Forum.Post.PostId context path. command or some other investigation.
commands.name: flashpoint-get-forum-post-details

commands.description: Searches forum sites using a keyword. it will search in site content like name, title, descripion etc.
commands.name: flashpoint-search-forum-sites

commands.description: Search forum posts using a keyword
commands.name: flashpoint-search-forum-posts

commands.description: Retrieves an alert or a list of alerts based on the filter values provided in the command arguments. Yields the alerts from Flashpoint collected sources and the alerts from data exposure.
commands.name: flashpoint-alert-list

commands.description: Retrieves the compromised credentials based on the filter values provided in the command arguments.
commands.name: flashpoint-compromised-credentials-list

integration.description: Use the Flashpoint integration to reduce business risk. Flashpoint allows users to ingest alerts and compromised credentials as incident alerts and executes commands such as search intelligence report, ip, url, get events, and more.
integration.name: Flashpoint (Partner Contribution)

playbook.description:
Compromised Credentials Match playbook uses the details of the compromised credentials ingested from the Flashpoint and authenticates using the Active Directory integration by providing the compromised credentials of the user, expires the credentials if it matches, and sends an email alert about the breach.
Supported integrations:
- Flashpoint
- OpenLDAP
- Active Directory Query v2
playbook.name: Compromised Credentials Match - Flashpoint

description: Use the Flashpoint integration to reduce business risk.
name: Flashpoint
readme:
Use the Flashpoint integration to reduce business risk. Flashpoint allows users to ingest alerts and compromised credentials as incident alerts and executes commands such as search intelligence report, ip, url, get events, and more.


## What does this pack do?
The actions in this pack helps you to determine risks and help to remediate tasks using playbook:
- Get alerts, compromised credentials, forum details, event details, report and reputation information.
- Investigate compromised credentials incident.

### Playbook
**Compromised Credentials Match - Flashpoint:** It authenticates and expires the credentials and sends an email alert.
![Compromised Credentials Match - Flashpoint](https://github.com/demisto/content/raw/f3d75c9da2e0e4d56ff087b86b941a21e0d63cb2/Packs/Flashpoint/doc_files/Compromised_Credentials_Match_-_Flashpoint.png)

_For more information, visit our [Flashpoint Developer Documentation](https://docs.fp.tools/)_
